job_title: Attending Physician in New York, NY
pros: benefits, team, work environment, staff
cons: more support staff, supplies, resources, job growth

review_title: There are pros and cons to this company
job_title: Physician Assistant in Bronx, NY
pros: Great benefits, improving compensation, decent amount of employment opportunities,
cons: They are very sneaky. You have to every so often check your paycheck and make sure you're getting the pay you're supposed to (for the hours worked, especially if you worked overtime for a given pay period), make sure you have the correct hourly rate, make sure you're receiving the correct vacation and sick rate per paycheck. They will not give you anything you deserve or have worked for unless you force the union (1199 which is also pretty darn useless) to fight and advocate for us. You are just a number in the company. Doesn't matter how great of an employee you are, if you put in your resignation they don't care to ask why you want to leave or counteroffer. It means nothing for them to have a high turn over rate.

job_title: Mental Health Treatment Aide in New York, NY
pros: The 1199 union benefits make the job worth it. Great experience working in a high paced, dangerous environment. Not a lot of micromanaging and the job is self explanatory, just stay safe. No mandatory overtime. The patients (inmates) can make or break your time on the job.
cons: There certainly was not any training when I came mid Covid, and they still have yet to resume any training of any sort. You'll never see upper management, unless you complain excessively via email, or there's some of "big" meeting. The same people from upper management are valued and receive promotions, yet the environment and culture seems to still remain in shambles. The only people valued are the ones with doctorate degrees, no ore how unprofessional or how less of a difference they made in their position. Assaults on front line staff (mental health treatment aides, clinicians etc.) are rarely addressed, unless it is "serious." All assaults are serious. Frontline staff are not treated with proper respect, only addressed if they did something "wrong."

job_title: Occupational Therapist in New York, NY
pros: Fantastic benefits: union benefits with no copay, no deductible. FSA plan, transitcheck, 401k, and vested pension at 5 years. Great vacation and sick leave, but limited opportunities to take time off due to scheduling. Never had issues with payroll
cons: The recent change in management is starting to drive this place into the ground. Micromanaging is starting to thrive here and there is little to no faith in your decisions as a therapist. Management questions your discharge planning and treatments, so don’t expect to practice without constant questioning. This used to be an inpatient rehab hospital that served the community regardless of background or documentation. As of late we have had patients admitted primarily based on insurance as opposed to actual need, all thanks to the change in management

review_title: Great Place to Work.  Good Salaries, Excellent Benefits and Supportive Leadership
job_title: Associate Director in New York, NY
pros: Relatively new corporation with a management team that welcomes input from employees at all levels of the company.  A workplace that encourages innovation, and provides leadership opportunities to mid-level managers.  Salaries are excellent, benefits are generous and PAGNY values all staff and recognizes the importance of a Work Life Balance.
cons: Consolidating the clinical and administrative staff of six hospitals that previously operated independently is a challenge.  If you thrive on professional challenges, this Con can be a Pro.

job_title: Physician Assistant in Bronx, NY
pros: Outstanding leadership team, working passionately to create a stable, efficient and accountable organization.  Competent understanding of the healthcare environment in New York City and excellent ability to overcome its challenges. Forward-thinking clinicians committed to deliver quality patient-care to the community.
cons: The company web site is outdated.
